item.title: [AVRO-1769] Depend on external libjansson instead of a bundled copy
item.description: To fix AVRO-1691 we need to update to a newer version of Jansson. However, rather than updating the version of Jansson that is bundled with Avro-C, this would be a good time to switch to a dynamically linked version. As Magnus Edenhill pointed out, libjansson is widely available in distributions nowadays.
item.summary: Depend on external libjansson instead of a bundled copy

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I will try to find some time to finalize the pull request for AVRO-1691 this week.

Attached patch. I extracted the relevant commits from Magnus Edenhill's pull request https://github.com/apache/avro/pull/57 and fixed the things pointed out by Sean Busbey on that pull request:

  • updated the documentation to declare Avro's dependency on libjansson
  • updated LICENSE files to add FindJansson.cmake, and remove Jansson itself and its build scripts
  • added libjansson-dev dependency to Dockerfile

Could you take another look please, Sean Busbey?

This looks good, though the FindJansson module is pretty old. Jansson ships a pkg-config file, so you could use pkg_check_modules(JANSSON jansson>=2.3) instead, like we do for lzma/xz. That has the added benefit of having CMake verify that the Jansson that we find meets our >=2.3 version requirement.

Douglas Creager: Thanks for reviewing. I've attached an updated patch that uses pkgconfig, and removes the FindJansson.cmake file (and the reference to it in LICENSES). I've tested the build both on Mac OS (using Jansson from Homebrew) and in Docker.
Does anyone have further comments on this? I'll commit this soon if there are no objections.

item.title: [AVRO-1770] Python 3 overwrites custom README.txt
item.description: Sean found while validating 1.8.0 rc1 that the py3 README is being changed by the release process.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The problem was that the setup script was overwriting the python3 file with the root README.txt for some reason. The file was identical before AVRO-1730 but now the python version has extra information. This uses the README from the py3 source directory and stops overwriting it. I've confirmed that the correct README is included with the distribution tarball.

item.title: [AVRO-1772] Ruby: load error in rubygem when loading schema normalization
item.description:
Martin Kleppmann found this bug while validating the 1.8.0 release:

kernel_require.rb:54:in `require': cannot load such file -- avro/schema_normalization (LoadError)

It seems that the following two files, which are present in the source, are missing from the gem file:

lang/ruby/lib/avro/schema_normalization.rb
lang/ruby/test/case_finder.rb
item.summary: Ruby: load error in rubygem when loading schema normalization

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Fixed in the attached patch file by adding to Manifest. I've verified that the gem now contains schema_normalization.rb and test/case_finder.rb and that requiring the gem works without the LoadError.

+1. I just noticed two more files that are in the repository but not the manifest:

  • test/test_fingerprints.rb
  • test/test_schema_normalization.rb

Less critical since they're tests, but might as well add them since there's no good reason to leave them out.
Missed one more file: test/test_schema.rb. Attached updated patch.
